recipe_name: Curried eggs with spicy tomato salsa
author: James Tanner
method: To make the salsa, place all the salsa ingredients into a food processor and blend until smooth. Season, to taste, with salt and freshly ground black pepper. To make the curried eggs, break the eggs into a large bowl and add the cayenne pepper, chilli flakes and cream. Whisk together well and season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Melt the butter in a frying pan over a medium heat and add the egg mixture. Gently cook, stirring continuously, until thickened and cooked to your liking. To serve, place the curried eggs onto a warm plate and spoon over some of the spicy salsa.
ingredients: 50g/1¾oz chopped tomatoes,  ¼ red onion, finely sliced,  ¼ orange pepper, thinly sliced,  15g/½oz fresh basil leaves,  ½ tsp dried chilli flakes,  salt and freshly ground black pepper ,  3 free-range eggs, whisked,  pinch cayenne pepper,  pinch dried chilli flakes,  50ml/2fl oz double cream,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  25g/1oz unsalted butter
